PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mr. Milton Preston, 53 Congress Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 8, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should jitney drivers be licensed and permitted to operate, or should they be jailed?" Answer reads: "They should be licensed to operate. After all, during the street car strike, if it weren't for the jitneys, some people would not have made it to work, and others might have lost their jobs."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Milton Preston wearing striped hat, geometrically patterned shirt, and dark corduroy jacket, standing with hands in pockets in front of vacant lots with telephone poles and buildings in background
